page.title: 03 Cycling in Stevenage
page.content: My B.M.X.is red and yellow.It is called a Raleigh Burner.The tyres are thick and yellow.The bike also has pads on it so if you fall,you will not hurt yourself.The pads are on the frame of the bike and between the handlebars.A B.M.X can do lots of tricks such as bunny-hops when you jump over something and wheelies when you ride on one wheel.At the Bowes-Lyon Centre there is a B.M.X. track to practice on.If you want to ride your bike in Stevenage, there are 30 miles of cycle ways.Mr. Claxton introduced cycle ways to Stevenage He built the first cycle way in 1950 from Six Hills Way to Gunnels Wood Road.There are underpasses to keep cyclists and cars apart at junctions and roundabouts.Mr.Claxton visited our school to tell us about his campaign to establish cycle ways in Stevenage.
